PROVIDER FAQS: MEDICA AND UCARE ANNOUNCE AN AGREEMENT

On Nov. 17, 2025, Medica and UCare announced a definitive agreement for Medica to acquire certain contracts and assets of UCare.

To assist providers with this transition, we have created a list of frequently asked questions.

As more information becomes available, we will update this page.



KEY REMINDERS FOR CLAIM SUBMISSION

As a reminder, providers should be submitting separately for claims that have 2025 dates of service and 2026 dates of service (unless an inpatient or hospital outpatient claim). This will allow the claim adjudication process to perform as intended and expedite payments.

See the Jan. 27 Provider Bulletin for details.

CONSUMER DIRECTED COMMUNITY SUPPORTS (CDCS) UNBUNDLING PROJECT REMINDERS

UCare follows the Minnesota Department of Human Services (DHS) guidelines for CDCS and its unbundling project, which introduced additional CDCS claim code modifiers.

See the Jan. 14 Provider Bulletin for details.

JANUARY 2026 HEALTH LINES

Learn about the following: UCare Rehabilitation website introduced, Product changes for 2026, Authorization grids released, Coverage policies, Documentation improvement: Cervical cancer, 2026 UCare provider training series, Fraud, waste and abuse reporting reminder and Upcoming holiday.

Read the January 2026 Health Lines.

UCARE PROVIDER FAQS UPDATED 1/20/26

On Dec. 17, 2025, UCare Minnesota was placed into Rehabilitation by order of the District Court, Second Judicial District, County of Ramsey. UCare Minnesota will continue under state regulatory supervision (Rehabilitation) to wind down its operations. Updated FAQs are available by dates of service (DOS)



DOS Dec. 31, 2025, and prior - Rehabilitation

DOS 2026 - Medica

PROVIDER PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT ASSIGNMENT NOTICE

Providers are advised to review the Provider Participation Agreement Assignment Notice in the linked Provider Bulletin.

See the Dec. 22 Provider Bulletin for guidance.

INAPPROPRIATE DENIALS OF SOME INPATIENT SERVICES CLAIMS

UCare has identified some instances of claims submitted between Sept. 22, 2025, and Dec. 8, 2025, for inpatient services that require authorization have been incorrectly denying. Authorization types that may be impacted by the issue are: acute inpatient rehabilitation, inpatient hospital, long-term acute care (LTAC), skilled nursing facilities (SNF)/nursing facilities (NF)/swing bed (skilled or custodial), substance use disorder (SUD) residential and withdrawal management.

See the Dec. 17 Provider Bulletin for details. 

UCARE TO DISCONTINUE MEDICARE SUPPLEMENT PLANS BEGINNING IN 2026

UCare will no longer offer Medicare Supplement (Medigap) plans after Dec. 31, 2025. Coverage for all current UCare Medicare members on Medicare Supplement plans will end on that date. These members will need to choose a new plan for 2026.

See the Dec. 12 Provider Bulletin for details.

UCARE TO DISCONTINUE DUAL ELIGIBLE SPECIAL NEEDS PLANS BEGINNING IN 2026

UCare will discontinue all dual eligible special needs plans or D-SNPs (UCare’s Minnesota Senior Health Options and UCare Connect + Medicare) as of Dec. 31, 2025. UCare and Medica worked diligently with the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) and the Minnesota Department of Human Services (DHS) to find a path to allow dual members to transition alongside Medicaid and Individual & Family Plans (IFP) products. Due to regulatory constraints and a mis-matched service area between UCare and Medica, the D-SNP transition was not allowed to move forward.

See the Dec. 5 Provider Bulletin for details.

Home > Providers > Provider Portal – My Quartz Tools

Provider Portal – My Quartz Tools
My Quartz Tools
My Quartz Tools

My Quartz Tools is a 24/7 provider portal that gives you fast access to the most current member and plan information. Use the portal to:

View member details, including demographics, eligibility, benefits, coverage summaries, and benefit riders
Submit and track prior authorizations, upload required documents, and review decisions
Check claims status and view remittance information
Send secure messages to Customer Success, including claims reconsideration requests

Access support

If you are new to the portal, you can get started by submitting the Access Request Form to get set up. If you’re locked out, your Site Administrator can help restore access. If your Site Administrator needs support, Quartz Customer Success is here to help at (800) 897-1923. Note you can still verify eligibility and check claim status, even without logging in.

Questions? Contact Customer Success at (608) 881-8271 or (800) 897-1923.

Contact us
Quartz is committed to providing superior customer service. That's one reason we offer so many ways to reach us.

Provider Central
L.A. Care Provider Central

The Provider Portal is your secure gateway to real-time tools and information that support your daily operations. From submitting Service Authorization Requests and checking claims status to accessing patient and provider details—everything you need is just a click away.

Need help? Visit the our Provider Portal Hub page for guides, support, and additional resources.

L.A. Care Provider Central
The New Provider Portal

We’re excited to announce the launch of L.A. Care’s enhanced Provider Portal—your new destination for fast, secure, and comprehensive online access to essential provider resources.

Through the new Portal, providers can now submit and track Service Authorization Requests (SARs) in real time, check the status of claims, and access detailed patient and provider information—all in one convenient platform.

To learn more about the updated features and available support materials, please visit the Provider Portal Hub web page.

Contracted Provider and need access? View our registration guide.

Already have access to the new Provider Portal? Sign in below.

Sign-in

Legacy Provider Portal

As we continue to enhance the features and functionality of our new Provider Portal, please note that all reporting and Add, Change, Delete (ACD) workflows remain available exclusively on the Legacy Provider Portal at this time.

If these features are essential to your daily operations, please ensure your access to the Legacy Portal is current. For step-by-step assistance with maintaining or restoring access, contact our Provider Services team at 1-866-LA-CARE6 (1-866-522-2736).

If you already have an account for the Legacy Provider Portal, please visit this sign-in page.

If you need to register for the Legacy Provider Portal, go to our legacy registration guide.

Access the Provider Portal Hub!

Looking for training resources? Need more information about the Provider Portal? Have a question or need to submit an inquiry? Explore the Provider Portal Hub—your go-to resource page for all things related to the Provider Portal!

Additional Provider Resources

Questions?

Call our Provider Services line at 1-866-LA-CARE6 (1-866-522-2736) if you have questions, or reach out to your provider network account manager.

Important Info Regarding Legacy and New Provider Portal

L.A. Care has launched a new Provider Portal, and all providers and staff must register immediately to avoid service disruptions.

The current (Legacy) Provider Portal will soon have limited functionality, supporting only reporting and the ACD tool. All other key features — including eligibility search, claims search, patient data, forms and templates — will only be available on the new portal.

To ensure uninterrupted access to essential tools, please register for the new Provider Portal today.

Register Now: Users can request access through their organization's Provider Portal Admin. If you are unsure who your Provider Portal Admin is, please contact your immediate supervisor/manager, L.A. Care Provider Network Account Manager, or send us a message. If you are a PCP or SCP contracted solely through a PPG, please contact your PPG directly to request access to the Provider Portal.

From eligibility verification and claims submissions to prior authorization forms and provider manuals, we’re here to streamline your partnership with us. Together, we ensure the health and well-being of our communities.

We’re happy to have you join us.

© Sentara Health Plans 2026, PO Box 66189, Virginia Beach, Virginia 23466

Sentara Health Plans is the trade name for Sentara Health Plans, Sentara Health Insurance Company, Sentara Health Administration, Inc., and Sentara Behavioral Health Services, Inc. Vantage Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) and Point of Service (POS) plans are issued and underwritten by Sentara Health Plans. Medicare products are administered under an agreement with Sentara Health Plans and the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). Medicaid and Family Access to Medical Insurance Security (FAMIS) products are administered under an agreement with Sentara Health Plans and the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS). Plus Preferred Provider Organization (PPO) products are issued and underwritten by Sentara Health Insurance Company. The Sentara Employee Assistance Program (EAP) is administered by Sentara Behavioral Health Services, Inc. Large group self-funded health plans and BusinessEDGE® plans are administered but not underwritten by Sentara Health Administration, Inc. Wellness programs are administered by Sentara Health Administration, Inc. All plans have benefit exclusions and limitations, and terms under which the policy or plan may be continued in force or discontinued. For costs and complete details of coverage, please call your broker or review this website for more information. Sentara Health Plans complies with applicable federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.
